content.description: Hand crack start in short right facing dihedral. Step off blocks onto closely bolted start on face and go up to anchors.
Some loose rock near the bottom, cool moves reaching the arete.
content.protection: Eleven clips plus a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
The third route left (for now) of the Afterburner Wall. Start in a short corner, make a hard move to reach (High) the first bolt. Move through a loose section and reach the arete. Continue straight up the arete moving a little left then back right. The quality of the rock improves greatly on the arete proper.    

  Great climb with good protection.

content.description: Start up mini arch with 2 bolts then go right on chossy ledge to arete and up technical corner. After the corner trend right to lower off. Be careful at the 4th clip (I think?)! FFA was done with 5 bolts!? Done on my birthday 2001.
Great arete climbing with  cool moves.
content.protection: Ten clips to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Far left side of the wall.

content.description: Beef of the route starts on the big partially detached pillar (watch for loose rock and sediment).To climb to the top of the pillar ledge. You can climb a much easier crack on the face or climb the offwidth on the left (#5 camalot if u want gear)Crux is at a small bulge with a long move to a crimp, then some tomfoolery to the next edge. Stay tight. Ticktack climbing to the top.
content.protection: Pretty sure it's 9 bolts. 3 chains at the top with carabiners. Optional 4 or 5 camalot for the offwidth.
content.location: This is the route between Windurn and Big Howie. Start below the large detached pillar ledge.

content.description: Climb broken overhanging face to thin moves above.

climbs.name: Big Howie
climbs.fa: Matt Samet, Bob D'Antonio, Mike Howard and Jay Foley

content.description:
Continuous climbing leads to crux moves near the top.  

  Great route and named for a wonderful friend Howie Doyle

Howie
content.protection: 11 clips will get you to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
On the left side of the               

A nice afternoon's worth of climbing.      .

content.description: Finger crack layback for 15' to chossy section, trend right then back left on blocks and up onto sustained face. Loose block getting onto face wouldn't come out.  Layback and crimp up face to wild bulge and anchor. ok rest before finish.  Great moves and  great rock on upper face.
content.location: Large white face right of gold rush wall.

content.description: Tallest and most austere of the walls at this crag. Several of the most continuous and sustained sport routes are found here.From Climber's right:BlockbusterAfterburnerWindburnFire it upBig HowiePinch to Grow and InchLet The Daylight InSpeed of Sound
